page.title: 07HEALTH CARE IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: Northwold has no resident doctor but is served by two practices in Stoke Ferry and Feltwell.Surgeries are held twice weekly in the village hall.For more serious illnesses there are cottage hospitals at Swaffham and Thetford and a modern well-equipped general hospital at Kings Lynn. The elderly are cared for at home or in private residential homes within 20-30 miles. Specialist care, i.e.opticians, dentists etc are available in the local towns.Children have a full medical in their first year at school and any problems encountered are referred to their parents for further action.A school dentist attends each year and recommends further action as necessary.A district nurse will visit villagers requiring help and a twice weekly meals on wheels service is available.
